keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, and Alison Smale from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Without an effective Europe-wide policy response, and facing growing public anger in many countries, Europe’s national leaders have splintered, searching for allies.

headline.print_headline: With No Unified Refugee Strategy, Europeans Fall Back on Old Alliances
headline.main: With No Unified Refugee Strategy, Europeans Fall Back on Old Alliances

snippet: Without an effective Europe-wide policy response, and facing growing public anger in many countries, Europe’s national leaders have splintered, searching for allies.
abstract: European Union belatedly moves to consolidate its plan to address migrant crisis just ahead of deadline set by European Council's powerful head Donald Tusk; rules enacted by some countries appear to violate both spirit of plan and EU law, leading some to worry that old bloc mentality is reviving to threaten continental solidarity.
